programme.title: The Encore Hour
programme.desc: A look at some of the drama programmes coming up on the channel this month.

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Edward becomes disillusioned with the behaviour of his `betters' when he sees Lord Charles Seymour leaving Lady Natalie Tewkesbury's bedroom in his dressing gown, and sparks political and private interest when he divulges his gossip at the local pub.

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A governess takes up a new position, but feels constrained to consult Holmes about some of the bizarre conditions stipulated by her employer. Period crime drama, guest starring Natasha Richardson, Joss Ackland and Patience Collier, with Jeremy Brett and David Burke.

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Village life is disrupted by a circus family who are accused of corrupting the vicar's daughter, wrecking the shop and breaking into the church. Meanwhile, Nick and Kate are attacked for resisting local bigots. Eleanor Bron guest stars, with Nick Berry and Niamh Cusack.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Personal dilemmas continue to overshadow the medical agenda, as Kate agonises over Will's suggestion that they move in together, and both of them begin to worry more for Andrew, who is on anti-depressants following the breakdown of his marriage. Unfortunately, he doesn't make things any easier for himself by getting over-involved with a pretty medical student. Drama, starring Simon Shepherd, Saskia Wickham and Gary Mavers.

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: DI Jane Preston and DS Ben Shaw investigate a theft from an elderly care-home resident after Sue Wilkins reports that £60 has gone missing from her father's chest of drawers. Although the man's carer becomes a suspect, Sue quickly finds the finger pointed at her by another member of staff. Drama filmed in the format of a documentary, with Jane Antrobus and Ben Hull, and guest stars Wendi Peters and Peter Baldwin (Coronation Street). Narrated by Tom Butcher.

programme.title: Noah's Ark
programme.desc: Tom grudgingly turns to Noah for help in treating a sick horse, but Clare is consumed by jealousy on realising the animal's owner - her best friend - could be a formidable romantic rival, forcing her to consider just where she stands. On the home front, Val surprises everyone by taking a stray under her wing. Veterinary drama, starring Anton Rodgers, Angela Thorne, Peter Wingfield and Orla Brady.

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick is seconded to a Scotland Yard team who have arrived in Aidensfield to investigate the fatal shooting of former policeman Andrew Gerard, and risks his career to ensure justice is done. Meanwhile, local man Alan Maskell is duped into helping a couple of crooks respray stolen cars. Nick Berry stars.

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Rose falls for an Australian, whose talk of the classless society Down Under makes her contemplate emigration. She hands in her notice and sets off to catch the boat - but begins to have second thoughts. Period drama, starring Jean Marsh.

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: An interpreter claims to have been abducted by two villains who forced him to interrogate a badly bruised and obviously distressed Greek captive unable to speak English. Period detective drama, starring Jeremy Brett.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth is called in to investigate when the UK's prime minister and his secretary are kidnapped in France. However, he has only a day and a half to solve the case before an important conference is set to take place. Drama, starring David Suchet.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A murder gives rise to rumours of a communist conspiracy. Poirot becomes the centre of attention at the Chelsea Flower Show as he views a rose named in his honour, while Hastings receives a packet of seeds that give him hay fever. Whodunit, guest starring Anne Stallybrass (Heartbeat), with David Suchet.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Rosamund comes up with a plan to help Edith out of her predicament, but will Violet see straight through it? Rose is frustrated when things don't go her way and Alfred realises too late he may have made a mistake. Anna is concerned by unexpected news just as she and Bates seem to be getting over the worst, Isobel finds herself the object of someone's attention and Mary asks Gillingham for a favour.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Adventure of the Western Star
programme.desc: A Belgian film star arrives in London and summons her friend Poirot to unravel the mysterious threats she has been receiving, which demand the return of a priceless diamond, the Western Star. Rosalind Bennett guest stars.

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel promised the chaos of her personal life was all in the past, but she is conflicted upon discovering her mother's new boyfriend is a violent domestic abuser. Meanwhile, Janet gets cold feet when she goes on her first date, terrified at the idea of having to impress a stranger. The crimebusters are united in the search for the killer of Rich Hutchings, who is found murdered in the flat he shares with his husband Adam. Barry, their outspoken and violent homophobic neighbour, is the prime suspect. However, as Adam's friend Tim struggles to recall the events of their night out, it seems Barry may be in the clear. Meanwhile, Rachel is horrified when her mum Sharon turns up asking for help. Crime drama, starring Suranne Jones, Lesley Sharp and Danny Miller.

programme.title: Band of Gold
programme.desc: Geraldine James, Cathy Tyson and Barbara Dickson head the cast of this six-part drama charting the lives of women working in a red-light district. A mother of three, separated from her husband and desperate to pay off a loan shark, becomes a prostitute in the hope of putting an end to her money worries - only to find a new set of problems as she adjusts to life on the streets. With Ruth Gemmell, Samantha Morton and David Schofield.

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: A shop assistant is hospitalised following an armed robbery, and DI Preston begins to suspect that one of the woman's colleagues played a part in the hold-up. Meanwhile, footage of a drug dealer's car links him to the crime, so officers put pressure on his girlfriend to confess what she knows. Drama, starring Jane Antrobus, Marc Silcock and Zoe Lister.

programme.title: Noah's Ark
programme.desc: Tom embarks on a mission to rescue a golden eagle, but with Clare along for the ride, it soon becomes clear he's not just after birds of the feathered variety. Noah is forced to think about his plans for the practice - and whether they will include his son - and the Baldwins cause much hilarity with their attempts to train their pooch. Anton Rodgers, Peter Wingfield and Orla Brady star.

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick's relationship with Kate suffers when he goes for a job interview in London, and Greengrass is convicted for sheep rustling, although holes in the evidence are discovered. Meanwhile, Alan Maskell leaves the area while on bail for and unbeknown to him, his wife suffers a miscarriage at the same time. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry.

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Hazel suffers a miscarriage and slips into despondency, though James seems unconcerned by the tragedy, and not only accompanies Georgina Worsley to a ball, but admits to finding her attractive.

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A solicitor enlists Holmes to help clear him of murdering eccentric builder Jonas Oldacre, whose considerable personal fortune he stood to inherit. Drama, starring Jeremy Brett as the famed Victorian detective.

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A murder gives rise to rumours of a communist conspiracy. programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A prominent bank manager is almost killed by a hit-and-run driver just before he is due to set sail on the luxury liner Queen Mary. Convinced his life is in danger, he persuades Poirot to accompany him - and his valuable shipment of liberty bonds - to New York. But the Belgian sleuth's main concern is his own terrible sea-sickness. David Suchet stars.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Sidney takes Geordie to Johnny Johnson's London jazz club, hoping to leave their worries in Grantchester for the night, but the backstage murder of Johnny's sister Claudette puts paid to that. When Archie, the victim's father and owner of the club, calls in a police officer pal to crack the case, Geordie immediately detects the copper is corrupt, while Sidney makes an important discovery about Claudette that she had kept hidden from all but those closest to her. As every lead seems to come back to Archie's violent past, recriminations within the family begin to play out.

programme.title: Ruth Rendell's Thirteen Steps Down
programme.desc: Two-part psychological thriller based on the novel, starring Luke Treadaway, Geraldine James, Gemma Jones and Elarica Gallacher. Notting Hill resident Mix Cellini has two dangerous obsessions - his hero, serial killer John Christie, and local supermodel Nerissa Nash. Mix is convinced he and Nerissa are in love and goes to extraordinary lengths to be close to her - but as his fixation grows more powerful, reality and fantasy blend - with disastrous results.

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: As Syndicate 9 investigates the discovery of a woman's body in a Manchester hotel room, Gill introduces Rachel to high-flying DS Will Pemberton, unaware they are already well acquainted - they've been having a passionate, secret relationship for months. But while the volatile copper can be discreet when it comes to romance, will she be able to hide her feelings when Gill lets slip that she wasn't the first choice for the sergeant's job? Meanwhile, Janet is keen to give her own love life a boost, especially after seeing how happy Ade is with his new partner Eleanor. However, a speed-dating event might not be the best option, as Janet finds herself treating each brief encounter like a police interrogation. Crime drama, starring Suranne Jones, Lesley Sharp, Amelia Bullmore, Steve Touissant and Mina Anwar.

programme.title: Living the Wildlife
programme.desc: Colin Stafford-Johnson explores the biodiversity of Tipperary woods, where he finds woodlice, centipedes, earthworms, slugs, beetles and spiders all battling to survive on the forest floor. The cameraman uses a special macro lens to capture unique footage of wood ants - but manages to get bitten in the process. He also receives guidance from Professor John Green of the University of Limerick. Last in the series.

programme.title: Fair City
programme.desc: As Wayne and Orla worry about Tommy's next move, Caoimhe demands he tell her the truth, while Rachel confronts Amanda over her bullying past. Despite Bob and Farrah's misgivings, Renee warms to Hughie, and Deegan warns Leo that covering for Paula could land him in trouble.

programme.title: Creedon's Weather: Four Seasons in One Day
programme.desc: John Creedon examines how people cope with the weather as he travels to Rossbeigh, Co Kerry, to see the effects of the winter storms on the coastline. He then visits the European Space Agency in Rome to investigate how they are developing systems to deal with extreme weather events in the future, before finding out how Ireland played its part in D-Day.

programme.title: Getaways
programme.desc: Angela Scanlon and Joe Lindsay enjoy a city break in Krakow, Poland, where they explore some of the markets and churches the Old Town has to offer and see a chapel carved out of rock salt. Angela also visits Dunluce Castle on the North Antrim coast.

programme.title: At Your Service
programme.desc: Hoteliers Francis and John Brennan help Louise Feeny as she takes over the running of her family's 11-bedroom hotel in Athenry, Co Galway, from her mother. It is in need of modernisation, and the new owner wants to put her stamp on the business but realises she has a lot of work to do - including tackling the tired tearoom and bland bedrooms. She faces some hard choices as she tries to make every penny count.

programme.title: Fair City
programme.desc: Wayne is concerned by Tommy's potential interest in Junior, while Renee tries to build bridges between Bob and Hughie. Leo wonders if he should follow Paula to Greece, and Rachel can only see disaster if Neil and Amanda get together.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Martin is keen to talk to Stacey about what happened at the wedding, but she would rather focus on making sure Lily has the perfect dress for her dance recital. Nancy grows more concerned about Lee after it turns out he has been missing work, Jane invites a reluctant Cindy over for dinner, and Denise is unimpressed when Kim offers her a job - as Pearl's nanny.

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Nick Hewer, host of Countdown and Alan Sugar's former adviser on The Apprentice, tries to find out how his mother's Catholic father Oswald Jamieson managed to reach the prestigious office of High Sheriff in Protestant-dominated 1920s Belfast. On his father's side, he researches the life of his nine times great-grandfather and discovers how his family's fortunes were shaped by the English Civil War. Narrated by Cherie Lunghi.

programme.title: Joey: The Man Who Conquered the TT
programme.desc: A profile of Joey Dunlop, the Northern Irish motorcyclist who won 26 races at the Isle of Man TT between 1976 and 2000, before his untimely death at an event in Estonia. With contributions from John McGuinness, Phil McCallen, Brian Reid, Mick Grant, Ron Haslam, Roger Marshall, Jim Dunlop and Neil Tuxworth.

American crime drama, starring Nathan Fillion and Stana Katic.

programme.title: Ireland's Ocean
programme.desc: Exploring the shallow seas around Ireland which are some of the most fertile on the planet due to storms churning up nutrients from the sea floor. These then combine with the sunlight to create an ecosystem which supports an abundance of life from microscopic plankton to an array of small, colourful creatures. Dr Cillian Roden outlines the potential impact of nitrate run-off from land to sea, and documents how invasive seaweeds are threatening areas of the coast.

programme.desc: The pals plan a surprise party for Rachel, but her recently separated mother and father show up. To keep the parents apart, the gang decides to have two different gatherings. Comedy, guest starring Marlo Thomas (That Girl) and Ron Leibman.

programme.desc: A revealing look behind the scenes at the Wright Venue, Ireland's biggest nightclub, as it gears up for its fifth birthday bash. As senior staff try to keep the show on the road, younger members of the team struggle to get their priorities in order.

programme.title: The Notorious
programme.desc: Conor McGregor prepares for the biggest fight of his career to date against Dustin Poirier, and tensions are high as both seek to gain the psychological edge. Back home in Dublin, Conor's family gets ready to fly to Las Vegas.

programme.title: The Notorious
programme.desc: Documentary following mixed martial artist Conor McGregor as he prepares for further successes in his sport.

programme.title: The John Bishop Show
programme.desc: The actor, comedian and charity campaigner presents an evening of entertainment, recorded at the Hackney Empire theatre in London. Each week, John introduces an international range of stand-up acts, along with his favourite musical performers, and a wide range of variety stars. In this first show, Paul Weller plays his new single Saturn's Pattern, and beatboxer Beardyman joins John to create some impromptu music. Plus, South Africa's Trevor Noah, the UK's own James Acaster, and Australian star Felicity Ward take to the stage for comedy sets.

Back in Chester's Mill, Big Jim encounters trouble almost immediately after deciding to take over as sheriff when the town's windmills are torn down - and it seems someone with a grudge against him is out for revenge. Sci-fi drama, starring Mike Vogel, Rachelle Lefevre and Dean Norris.

programme.desc: The women of the castle mingle with potential suitors during First Light, but much to Mary's dismay Lola is reluctant to participate. Kenna fears for her safety and confides in Queen Catherine after another violent incident with the increasingly erratic King Henry. Meanwhile, Bash experiences the terrors of the woods, and vows to uncover the truth behind the Darkness. Starring Adelaide Kane and Toby Regbo.
